comment: Really enjoyable class. Get the textbook to help with the tests!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: If you can take someone else. Tests are hard and she does help explain or give study guides that are useful. Doesn't respond to emails.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Tests are hard. The material she gives to study doesn't align with the test. She won't help you understand what you get on tests because she doesn't respond to emails. You are teaching yourself. The only form of learning would be a PowerPoint that doesn't correlate with anything. Best of luck because she's the only professor teaching this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She's very nice and helpful but only has 6 grades ( 3 assignments and 3 exams). It's way harder than human communication is supposed to be. I would not recommend her if you are looking for an easy class. There is some extra credit on the exams but other than that there is none.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Teaching style is rapid. She is very selective about the question she will answer in class. If she put it in the syllabus she won't repeat it in class. It's like she rushes to get out of class earlier than the planned time. I became very uncomfortable about asking questions in class. Her sweetness does not make up her rushing through the material.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I took her communications class online and if I were you, I would definitely take this class in person. The class was straight-up textbook/self-taught with very little help from the instructor. There are no study guides or ways to properly study for the test other than to examine every page of the extremely long textbook (which may be difficult).
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: she's very nice and helpful but only 6 grades. made it way harder than human communication needs to be. would not recommend her if you are looking for easy class. assignments are easy but tests are overcomplicated. does not give extra credit or bump your grade if needed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: she makes you do a lot of unnecessary work. she made us figure out what careers we wanted and make a video and sparkpage and made us go OTT for simple stuff. her tests are difficult. ALSO, there are no lectures. she makes you read the textbook and tests you on applying those concepts. if you do take her, get ready to be called scholar *eye rolls*
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She sucks. Good luck if you have to have her as a professor, because she gatekeeps classes.

Shes fabulous. Responds to emails quickly, and I even had some great conversations with her as a result. Tests are open notes and you wont pass them unless you take thorough notes and read the book. Instructions on assignments are SUPER thorough, and the course is user friendly. She uses a two-week module system, so you can spread things out.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: This class is really difficult. Your first priority at the beginning of the semester should be getting on a solid team. It'll really make or break the rest of the semester. She's really sweet and encouraging and she cares a lot about her students. Super tough grader though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: This capstone course is harder than necessary. She always does THE MOST w/ EVERYTHING. She tries to be encouraging but it comes off as condescending. MAKE SURE to have a great group, client, and facilitator. It will still be ridiculously hard, but those three things make it manageable. Dont bother asking questions, "you should know that already"
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Allison is very condescending to her students and disrespectful toward students. She gets mad when students don't ask questions in class, but when they do ask questions, she says we should already know the answer. She has a monopoly on the Audits class, but it could be taught better by a less uptight professor. DO NOT TAKE HER.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: This is the hardest intro class that I have ever taken! Her test were impossible. If you have to take her class, take it with some easy classes because her tests are weighted so heavily, if you don't pass them you will fail the course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Allison was a really sweet woman but her online class was very difficult due to the tests. The tests were open note but that did NOT help. The tests were also timed and the questions were very tough. I would only take her again in person to see if that's better than online. I take online classes regularly so I was bummed that it didn't go well.
rating_tags: Respected--Test heavy--Caring

comment: Dr. Allison is a tough professor and this class is not easy. It is a senior capstone class and she expects you to work hard for your grade. Your success will result in having a good group that meets regularly and adheres to deadlines. Definitely not impossible but be prepared to work hard every week.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT take this class online. Her exams are impossible, even if you study a lot for them. Her exams require a lockdown browser and only gives a small time period to take the tests. I have never struggled so much in a class. Her reviews are no help, and there are barely enough grades to make up for failing a test. DO NOT DO IT!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Allison was overall a fine professor. She is really sweet, but she talks to the class like their elementary school students. Lots and lots and lots of group work so choose the ones you work with carefully. I felt like we never fully learned the material because she clicks the PPTs so freaking fast and she's only cares about group work. Easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Audits is hard, but not impossible. Find a good group, keep up with deadlines, study for exams, and have a positive attitude. This class is very time consuming. Meet with your group often to edit and go over the report. Dr. Allison is a great professor and she wants everyone to succeed. Congratulation on nearing the end of your college career!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I took Dr. Allison for Audits. The class is difficult, but choose a good group and client and you will survive. There are two tests and they are tough, so study well. The audit report is broken up into three sections. She grades those sections harsh, but use those edits to your advantage. Keep your head up, you've made it this far!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Alison is very nice and fun to listen to. Do not rely on anything other than the book. Her powerpoints are vague and she goes extremely fast. There is a group project and you will be very confused on all the requirements for each part. You will have to ask multiple questions to understand everything completely.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: As long as you keep up with the assignments, listen in class, open the textbook during the semester, and look at the rubrics for things, you will be fine. I liked the group activities in this class. Professor Allison is a great professor and the class time goes by quickly. I would take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Allison is one of my favorite professors at KSU. She does expect a lot out of students but never does so to overwhelm anyone. There are a lot of assignments but they're all pretty simple since it really just focuses on our own goals, aspirations, etc. Anytime I had a question, she'd always try to help me and answer. Overall, a great class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Caring

comment: I took Professor Allison for Com 3345 and Com 4455. She is one of my favorite professors at KSU. She helped me when I was struggling. I won't lie, the classes were challenging, but I learned a lot that I now use in the real world. If you need help, just ask. She is super nice.
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Dr. Allison is professor that will bring the best out of her students. While in her courses, I learned the importance of preparation and working with others. Allison, created an environment that motivated me to push the limits of my learning abilities. She referred to all of her students as scholars which elevated our mindset regarding learning.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Allison has no business being a professor. Do not skip class and take as many notes as possible or you will fail. She expects you to remember everything she says and doesn't give any guidelines on her rubrics. It is physically impossible for her to give an A on an assignment. She makes an easy class extremely hard. AVOID HER.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This was my senior graduation requirement course so I expected to work hard! Make sure you form relationships with your fellow classmates early in the semester because you are going to have to form teams. Your team WILL make or break your grade. Stay focused, you can do this.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I did not feel like I could ask questions to her. I did not want to go to class because it was confusing and not real instructions were given. I do not wish to take her again.

She's an okay teacher. You'll have to work 4 ur grade & not a miss a single assignment. Her tests r from the book exactly. There is no extra credit. If u do bad on 1 exam don't expect to come back from it :( She only does a few writing assignments & then 2 papers. Overall not that bad of a class thou sucks if u mess up that 1 test like I did :(
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I've only gotten through 2 modules and i'm only one month deep into this class and I'm already leaving a horrible review. Dr. Allison is awful. She does not give clear instruction, has undefined expectations, and is extremely unorganized.   DO NOT TAKE HER.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: A lot of writing assignments. Three exams and a final. Read the book and you will do well. She needs to improve on giving clear instructions regarding her writing assignments. Just ask her to clarify, and she will kindly do so. She is very nice. Overall, she is a good teacher.

A lot of writing, and reading. But she provides ample time to complete assignments. She doesn't overwhelm her students with homework. If you read the chapters, you are guaranteed to pass her exams. She responds quickly to emails and is willing to explain any questions you have.

She grades paper hard, but it helps you be a better writer. She expects you to work for your grade and earn it on your own. Her tests are difficult, however, she has modified them to where instead of writing a paper at the end of the test, you fill in the blank (10 questions) + 2 extra credit normally. She is willing to help, you just have to ask!

CONS: Professor Allison means well but she falls short in several ways. She is unclear most of the time and can be annoyingly unconventional. Her excessive use of jargon combined with her tendency to overanalyze simple concepts makes the course far more difficult than it needed to be. PROS: She is very helpful and is truly invested in her students.

This professor was really awesome! I took her for group comm and she was so helpful. Offers help all the time and she is easy to understand. She answers emails all the time. She outlines everything to the T in her syllabus and makes it easy to know what is due and when. I would highly recommend this teacher, especially if it is for a hybrid class.

Professional & knowledgable. Tends to use a fair amount of jargon & expects perfection from students. Her  assignments can be somewhat unclear & unrealistic at times, so ask for tons of clarification! She tends to give frequent unconstructive & obtrusive life advice. She's a good instructor, just not everyone's cup of tea. Be prepared to work!

Dr. Allison is excellent. I would take her for every class if I could. I took her for 2205 Maymester. TIPS: READ the text, ASK QUESTIONS, use your class partner, form study groups. Even if the worksheet isn't hw, DO IT, it guides the test along w/ study guides. Movie clips are relevant. ADAPT & OVERCOME!

Dr. Allison is a fabulous teacher. Explains everything in great detail, clear on expectations from day 1. Can be intimidating, but she is a great teacher. A lot is expected, but after all we are in college. If you do your work, participate in & attend class, you will get an A.
One of the best professors I have ever had. Organized, extremely helpful and sets you up for success. Go to class, participate and take notes. You will get the grade you worked for.

Group com is a hard class. Do not take the hybrid if there is a choice. I learned more in this class with this prof than any other class. Work hard, learn hard. She is very open for discussion and I love stopping by her office.
Dr. Allison is passionate about teaching and is accessible after class to discuss com topics or other matters. She an excellent professor.

Dr. Allison is a brilliant professor!  She is an educator in every sense of the word.  I recommend you come to class prepared to do the work.  You will earn your grade in her class, but more importantly, if you apply yourself you will acquire knowledge that will be most helpful in your life and career.  I made a high "B" in her class, I earned it!

You all need to grow up! If you want an easy A take your ass to community college. This woman has to deal with students sleeping in class, and typing messages on facebook. Learn how to write and comprehend what you are reading and you will do fine. Also, if you don't want to read the book: DON'T BUY IT!!!!!! You should appreciate someone who cares.

Dr. Allison is the best professor in the Communication department at Kennesaw.  I apply the material that I learned in her class to everyday work and social situations.  She is a tough professor, but its for the best.

Prof Allisontakes her class way too seriously. She is extremely repetative and easly gets on your nerves.  Good luck if you decide to take her.  Get ready for a boring semester! Her tests are also very hard and grading is unreasonable.

Dr. Allison is so smart.  She really wants you to learn and grown.  Her favorite saying is adapt and overcome.  Read the chapters before you come to class.  Buy a mini stapler.  She has different type of sense of humor.

If you follow Dr. Allison's instructions, you will have no problem getting a good grade in this class.  "Adapt and overcome" has become part of my philosophy, because people that are unable to adapt and overcome obstacles are less efficient in an organization.

VERY hard,I am an A student and her tests were impossible. She is very tough with grading,she is a nice person, but not a good teacher when it comes to being straight forward on tests and grading. Bottom line you know the material or you don't and even if you know it in her class expect it to be hard.

Dr. Allison is an excellent professor.  She is enegetic and dedicated.  Dr. Allison expects for a student to do their part in her classroom.  She has an open door policy and will help any student who is struggling, just make an appointment with her and she will be there to assist. One of the best instructors at KSU! Just GO TO Class.

All I can say is WOW.  She is extremely confusing and I have no clue how I passed the class.  I worked REALLY hard and still failed both her tests!!  Thank God I will never have to take her again...haha...Whoever tells you she's good, is lieing to you. She IS the worst teacher I have ever had. Take Philip Aust instead, you won't regret it!

I thought she was okay at the beginning of the semester, until i realized that her tests are impossible, no matter how hard you study, yet,she tries to get every one to participate in class, it doesn't help to when it comes to getting a grade level up. I busted my ass in this class and was shy by 5 points to a B and she wouldn't budge. mistake....
Although she is a tough cookie. HEr teaching methods are great if you are a visual learner. She is vibrant and by far the best teacher I have had at KSU yet.

I took her Org Com and Group Com. She's TERRIBLE. I am an straight A student and I had to bust my butt in her class. Her papers are RIDICULOUS and you never know what she's asking from you in assignments or tests. If you don't read the book and work really hard you'll fail. I will NEVER make the mistake of taking her again.

Dr. Allison is a WONDERFUL teacher, and you WILL learn a lot from her. If a student has something negative to say, it's because he/she was too lazy to read the Chapters. U need to read them to understand lectures. The movies are fun and the class is interactive. YOU WILL LEARN FROM HER. I got an A easily. Many take her again for Group COM...

She is extremely annoying! She insist on treating her classes like they are in 1st grade, rather than in college!She is not consistant in what she wants and she relates everything to racial dicrimination in the work place!!
No Comments
She was a tough cookie in the beginning, but loosened up a bit towards the end of the semester.  She will make you work for the grade...Ok and I learned alot from her.
